title: Drawing, "The Elevation of a Mantlepiece and Adjoining Niche", ca. 1770
medium: Pen and brush and black ink, wash on white laid paper
markings: Watermark: right half of Strasburg lily with 4 over DL
inscribed: In pen and black ink, lower left: inv. F.Delafosse; lower center: 5 pieds (struck out); In pen and brown ink, within mirror: M. 186 (struck out)
provenance: Hippolyte Destailleur (sale Paris, May 19, 1896, no. 98 (85 francs); Léon Decloux as of 1906
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: The right half of the mantlepiece and the left half of the niche are shown. A winged sphinx with fish tails serves as a part of the support of the entablature of the mantle.  Mirror frame decorated at top with winged mermaid; candelabrum at right.  Above niche, a putti with festoon below.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "The Elevation of a Mantlepiece and Adjoining Niche", ca. 1770.
ca. 1770. Pen and brush and black ink, wash on white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-45.
